data.text:
If you feel stressed and exhausted during the process of learning music, why not take some time during your leisure to watch these movies about classical music and relax your body and mind? Let’s embark on a captivating journey through the world of classical music with these five remarkable films!

“Amadeus” (1984): This critically acclaimed film tells the fictionalized story of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, one of the greatest composers in history. It explores the complex relationship between Mozart and his contemporary composer Antonio Salieri, delving into themes of talent, jealousy, and artistic genius.

“Shine” (1996): Based on a true story, “Shine” follows the life of Australian pianist David Helfgott. The film portrays his early prodigious talent, his struggles with mental illness, and his ultimate triumph as a concert pianist. It is a moving and inspiring tale of resilience and the power of music.

“The Pianist” (2002): Directed by Roman Polanski, this film is set during World War II and tells the true story of Polish pianist Władysław Szpilman. It portrays his survival in the Warsaw Ghetto and his connection to music as a means of hope and solace in the midst of unimaginable circumstances.
